CrossingConnectionElement Class Reference

Describes a connection from to a crossing and contains information about angle, roadclass, entry restrictions and if the streetsegment of the connection is a ramp, part of a roundabout and if it is multi digitalized. More...

#include <Crossing.h>

Detailed Description

Describes a connection from to a crossing and contains information about angle, roadclass, entry restrictions and if the streetsegment of the connection is a ramp, part of a roundabout and if it is multi digitalized.

Definition at line 59 of file Crossing.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

CrossingConnectionElement::CrossingConnectionElement (  float64  angle,
float64  endNodeAngle,
byte  nodeNbr,
byte  roadClass,
bool  roundabout,
bool  ramp,
bool  multiDig,
Vector  name,
ItemTypes::entryrestriction_t  restr,
bool  ctrlAcc = false,
uint32  length = 0,
ItemTypes::junction_t  junction = ItemTypes::normalCrossing,
bool  roundaboutish = false
) 
 

Creates a new CrossingConnectionElement.

Parameters:
angle The angle of this connection.
endNodeAngle The angle from the node in the crossing to the SSI's other node. Only used when merging two multiDig CCE's to one.
node The index of the node in the crossing to which this connection leads.
roadClass The road class of the connection.
roundabout True if this connection is part of a roundabout.
ramp True if this connection is part of a ramp.
multiDig True if this connection is multi digitalized.
name A vector with the name indexes of this connection.
restr The restrictions for LEAVING the crossing through this connection.
ctrlAcc True if this connection has controlled access. (Default value used to ease its introduction.)
length the lenght of the SSI of this element.
junction The type of junction when leaving the crossing on this element
